div.a: The Humble Beginnings Of Apple's Brushed Metal

div.div: While most people think of Mac OS X 10.3 Panther or some drunken loser when they hear the term “brushed metal” in the context of UI design, the interface is far older than either of those two things.

div.div: BREAKING THE 5TH WALL WOULD BE COOLER

div.a: The Fate of Google Glass

div.div: So here’s the deal on Google Glass. At least as far as I know – what with my being from the future and all. It flopped. Nobody bought it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VOpsHz&via=Digg&text=The Fate of Google Glass

div.a: The Dark Underbelly Of The Miss USA Pageant

div.div: Ashleigh Blake never dreamed of becoming a beauty queen. But when a recruitment associate for Miss California USA, the splashiest state franchise in Donald Trump's Miss Universe pageant ecosystem, sent Ashleigh a message in November 2012 expressing interest in scheduling a meeting, she responded right away. What happened next was more like a nightmare.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X0kcy7&via=Digg&text=The Dark Underbelly Of The Miss USA Pageant

div.a: 'Tis The Season For Sperm

div.div: Autumn is the time of year most associated with bumper crops of new babies, and according to an Israeli study there may be a scientific reason for it: human sperm are generally at their healthiest in winter and early spring.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YQtnU5&via=Digg&text='Tis The Season For Sperm

div.a: Japan Turns The Only Tree Not Destroyed By The Tsunami Into A Massive Sculpture

div.div: As cleanup continues two years after the deadly tsunami that struck Japan, a decision was made to preserve the memory of the miracle pine tree by turning it into a monument.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZfXwM5&via=Digg&text=Japan Turns The Only Tree Not Destroyed By The Tsunami Into A Massive Sculpture

div.div: Victorian England made the strongest locks in the world—until an American showed up and promised he could pick them.

div.a: Astrobiologists Find Ancient Fossils In Meteorite Fragments

div.div: Algae-like structures inside a Sri Lankan meteorite are clear evidence of panspermia, the idea that life exists throughout the universe, say astrobiologists.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZzvGfF&via=Digg&text=Astrobiologists Find Ancient Fossils In Meteorite Fragments

div.a: Watch Bystanders Form A Human Chain To Save A Boy From Drowning

div.div: A human chain of bystanders rescued a twelve year old boy pulled out to sea by rough surf in New Zealand.

div.a: Zen Robots And Augmented Reality Porta Potties

div.div: The folks from Frog Design have been throwing the official SXSW Interactive kickoff party for ten years. First it was just a chance for a few nerds to get drunk. Then it got so big, the fire department came and shut it down. Now it's become a sort of high tech art fair meant to spark a conversation about the future of the digital world.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y9xWch&via=Digg&text=Zen Robots And Augmented Reality Porta Potties

div.div: OF COURSE HE'S SPONSORED BY MONSTER

div.a: If Superheroes Were Sponsored By Brands

div.div: Many of our favorite superheroes fight crime for the greater good—but what if they were sponsored by brands and made to ‘represent’ the companies that paid them?

div.a: The Dark History Of The Russian Ballet

div.div: A gun, Filin thought, in that flash of confrontation: He’s holding a gun and I am dead. Bolt! But, before he could move, his attacker swung his arm out in front of him. In his hand was a glass jar filled with liquid, and he hurled its contents at Filin’s face. A security camera in the parking lot fixed the time at 23:07. The liquid was sulfuric acid—the “oil of vitriol,” as medieval alchemists called it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YVeJId&via=Digg&text=The Dark History Of The Russian Ballet

div.a: Why I Hacked 'Donkey Kong' For My Daughter

div.div: One day after work, she asked to play Donkey Kong, only this time she raised a pretty innocent and simple question: “How can I play as the girl? I want to save Mario!”

div.div: BETTER MAKRE SURE THEY DON'T DISAPPEAR

div.a: Tiny Particles Packed With Bee Venom Kill HIV

div.div: A team at Washington University School of Medicine in St. Louis used nanoparticles carrying a toxin found in bee venom to destroy HIV without harming nearby cells.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YSrNRJ&via=Digg&text=Tiny Particles Packed With Bee Venom Kill HIV

div.div: MAY THE RATINGS BE WITH YOU

div.a: New Animated 'Star Wars' Series Coming To TV

div.div: Now that Lucasfilm is moving full steam ahead on a new “Star Wars” trilogy, the company is starting to get its TV universe in order. On Monday came word that Lucasfilm has “decided to pursue a new direction in animated programming.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14OAdKQ&via=Digg&text=New Animated 'Star Wars' Series Coming To TV

div.a: Vatican Made €23M Investment That Includes Europe's Biggest Gay Sauna

div.div: A day ahead of the papal conclave, faces at the scandal-struck Vatican were even redder than usual after it emerged that the Holy See had purchased a €23 million (£21 million) share of a Rome apartment block that houses Europe’s biggest gay sauna.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WZwWoJ&via=Digg&text=Vatican Made €23M Investment That Includes Europe's Biggest Gay Sauna

div.a: Your Guide To New York's Soda Ban

div.div: It has incited protests and lawsuits, inflamed public debate and inspired other cities to develop anti-soda tactics of their own. But for all the hand-wringing, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s much-derided ban on the sale of large sugary drinks, unveiled in May, will go into effect on Tuesday exactly as the city proposed. Here's what you need to know.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZDAEGb&via=Digg&text=Your Guide To New York's Soda Ban
